Sequence Information.Source: Viola biflora (Yellow wood violet) & Viola odorata (Sweet violet)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.16872274]Human tumor cell lines:RPMI-8226/s (IC50=0.12 µM), RPMI-8226/Dox40 (IC50=0.12 µM), RPMI-8226/LR-5 (IC50=0.12 µM), U-937GTB (IC50=0.26 µM), U-937Vcr (IC50=0.20 µM), ACHN (IC50=0.22 µM), CCRF-CEM (IC50=0.11 µM), CCRF-CEM/VM-1 (IC50=0.14 µM), NCI-H69 (IC50=0.12 µM), NCI-H69AR (IC50=0.26 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref:16872274] It has 35% hemolytic activity at 1.0 μM and 60% hemolytic activity at 1.5 μM against human type A red blood cells
Sequence Information.Function: Probably participates in a plant defense mechanism. Has strong cytotoxic activity against a variety of drug-resistant and drug-sensitive human tumor cell lines, and against primary chronic lymphocytic leukemia and ovarian carcinoma cells. Has weaker cytotoxic activity against normal lymphocytes. Has hemolytic activity.
Sequence Information.PTM: This is a cyclic peptide which contains three disulfide bonds 4-20; 8-22; 13-27.

Literature.Title: A novel suite of cyclotides from Viola odorata sequence variation and the implications for structure, function and stability..
